chat.server

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • chat.server.Server

  • public class Server
extends Object
    This class defines server object. The server ojbect connects to existing chat servers, waits for connections from other chat servers and from chat clients, and forwards chat messages received from chat clients to other 'local' chat clients and to the other chat servers. The chat servers can be organised into a network topology forming cycles since the method forward is only called when the message to forward has not already been received and forwarded.
    Author:
    chris, Denis Conan

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int OFFSET_ID_CLIENT
      the offset to compute the identity of the new client has a function of the identity of the server and the number of connected clients.

        See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server(String[] args)
        initialises the collection attributes and the state of the server, and creates the channels that are accepting connections from clients and servers. At the end of the constructor, the server opens connections to the other servers (hostname, identifier) that are provided in the command line arguments. NB: after the construction of a client object, the thread for reading messages must be started using the method startThreadReadMessagesFromNetwork.
        Parameters:
        args - java command arguments.

      • addServer

        public void addServer(String host,
                      int port)
               throws IOException
        connects socket, creates MsgWorker, and registers selection key of the remote server. This method is called when connecting to a remote server. Connection data are provided as arguments to the main.
        Parameters:
        host - remote host's name.
        port - remote port's number.
        Throws:
        IOException - the exception thrown in case of communication problem.

      • acceptNewServer

        public void acceptNewServer(ServerSocketChannel sc)
                     throws IOException
        accepts connection (socket level), creates MsgWorker, and registers selection key of the remote server. This method is called when accepting a connection from a remote server.
        Parameters:
        sc - server socket channel.
        Throws:
        IOException - the exception thrown in case of communication problem.

      • acceptNewClient

        public void acceptNewClient(ServerSocketChannel sc)
                     throws IOException
        accepts connection (socket level), creates MsgWorker, and registers selection key of the local client. This method is called when accepting a connection from a local client.
        Parameters:
        sc - server socket channel.
        Throws:
        IOException - the exception thrown in case of communication problem.

      • sendToAllServers

        public void sendToAllServers(int type,
                             int identity,
                             int seqNumber,
                             Serializable msg)
                      throws IOException
        sends a message to all the remote servers / neighbours connected to this server. This is a utility method for implementing distributed algorithms in the servers' state machine: use this method when this server needs sending messages to its neighbours.
        Parameters:
        type - message's type.
        identity - sender's identity, that is the identity of this server.
        seqNumber - message's sequence number.
        msg - message as a serializable object.
        Throws:
        IOException - the communication exception thrown when sending the message.

      • sendToAServer

        public void sendToAServer(SelectionKey targetKey,
                          int type,
                          int identity,
                          int seqNumber,
                          Serializable mgg)
                   throws IOException
        sends a message to a particular remote server / neighbour. This is a utility method for implementing distributed algorithms in the servers' state machine: use this method when this server needs sending messages to a given neighbour.
        Parameters:
        targetKey - selection key of the neighbour.
        type - message's type.
        identity - sender's identity, that is the identity of this server.
        seqNumber - message's sequence number.
        mgg - message as a serializable object.
        Throws:
        IOException - the communication exception thrown when sending the message.

      • sendToAllServersExceptOne

        public void sendToAllServersExceptOne(SelectionKey exceptKey,
                                      int type,
                                      int identity,
                                      int seqNumber,
                                      Serializable s)
                               throws IOException
        sends a message to all the remote servers / neighbours connected to this server, except one. This is a utility method for implementing distributed algorithms in the servers' state machine: use this method when this server needs sending messages to all its neighbours, except one.
        Parameters:
        exceptKey - the selection key of the server to exclude in the forwarding.
        type - message's type.
        identity - sender's identity, that is the identity of this server.
        seqNumber - message's sequence number.
        s - message as a serializable object.
        Throws:
        IOException - the communication exception thrown when sending the message.
